item.description:
Hi, 

I am looking for 7 volunteers to help out at the Merrimack Valley chapter of Habitat for Humanity in Lawrence on Saturday January 26th from 8:15 am to 4:00 pm. 

For those who have volunteered with Habitat for Humanity in the past you know what wonderful things they do. For those who have not and would like to, here is your chance to experience first hand what they do. Please know that you do not need to be a skilled tradesperson to help out (trust me on this one). All that is needed is a desire to help out however you can. We all make a difference there. 

Also, if getting to Lawrence is a challenge, do not let that stop you. I have room for three people and maybe someone else can provide a ride as well??? We can work out the logistics over the next few days. 

Some details for this. 

-> Food and water. You can either bring a lunch or go out to lunch. I bring a lunch when I go due to it being that much easier for me. 

-> If you have work gloves please bring them just in case. 

-> If you have work boots or hiking boots... I would wear them instead of sneakers. 

-> Weather. Should we have bad weather that day, Habitat for Humanity will cancel the event. That said, we can exchange phone numbers and/or emails before the 26th to make sure we are all informed in the event of bad weather. 

-> There is a waiver form you will all need to sign and bring with you. You can print from the following link.

http://volunteerup.com/Waivers/Merrimack_Waiver'12.pdf 


-> Address for us to meet at is 100 Parker Street, Lawrence. This is the main meeting point for all volunteers for this chapter. It is also the site of a project that is converting a convent into 10 condo units. An incredible project. 

-> Here is a link to the website for Habitat For Humanity Merrimack Valley. If you have a few minutes, check it out. They have a group of awesome people running the chapter up there and they are doing some great things. 

http://www.merrimackvalleyhabitat.org/ 


Thank you in advance. 

Tom Grady

 

www.BostonVolunteer.org

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Habitat for Humanity: Lawrence
